author: busyguy1
title: The Cardano Classroom
description: Early education sorely lacks curriculum on financial independence, even less so on blockchain, increasing the wealth gap.

f6_assessments.q0: From my understanding, this proposal aims to spread knowledge about blockchain technology and Cardano but with a focus on younger ages, by creating an educational platform. There are currently not many projects that focus on building awareness and knowledge from early ages, so this proposal has a very unique perspective and purpose that definitely adress the challenge brief. Educating our growing community will always be a priority, and addressing that problem on the "seed-level" and having the purpose of creating a sub-community from that is highly valuable through my experience as a teacher and community participant. It might not only include younger people to Cardano, but also spread information and knowledge to their parents, friends and contacts. Even if they have experience with blockchain or not. The details of the proposal is presented clearly with a strong connection to the problem statement. It is somewhat presented (and I would agree) that this is a slow burning project and a long term investment which would explain why some parts are explained more broadly, closer to detailed concepts than numbers and figures. All in all, I strongly agree that this proposal effectively adressess the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal clearly states what it means to achieve within a certain timeframe, and what is needed to make that happen. What's really important is that the proposer aims to continue developing the project whether or not it is received funding in FUND7, which speaks about long term determination and commitment. The website is live (but no active platform yet, time frame is provided in the road map). Since it means to do a lot within a very short timeframe, the budget allocation is quite substantial (1/4 of the total challenge budget), which might be too large for an initial funding round. Maybe the project would benefit from focusing on the core aspects of the platform (education, curriculum, videos etc) and leave things like "immersive technologies" til a later fund? I understand the value of launching a fully realized project from the start, but from my experience as a teacher it might have been more beneficial to focus on the core educational content and teachers working on it in initial stages in order to increase the chance of getting funds. 
I would have liked to see more verifiable information and background about the creators of this project, maybe a LinkedIn-profile to further strengthen the pedagogical expertise of the core creators? There is a podcast interview being linked, which gives some information about the proposers background and knowledge. Also, there are mentions of a personal LinkedIn, but that is not included. 
The team seems to be missing a lot of technical expertise, but this is taken into consideration in the budget allocation. This might explain why some technical or specific aspects are not included in the detailed plan, which would have been beneficial to include in the proposal. 
 I agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a clear roadmap with included timeframe in the proposal. It is ambitious spanning through 6 months initially, but the proposer makes it clear that there are more milestones and goals in the time following it. I believe it would be beneficial for the proposal if it included more KPIs or success metrics. Currently the info provided is relying on the onboarded community and educational interactions, but there are no numbers to measure the success and development of the project. There is a mention of a goal of 30-60 Beta testing-students, which provide us with some measurements of success. 
The budget breakdown is very clearly presented, but it would be nice to see some further details included in regards to estimated working hours. For example, 8000 USD is allocated to vetted educators but it would strengthen the proposal further to include the estimated working hours, number of educators etc. The proposer seem to have a decent understanding of the risks and challenges connected to developing the project, mainly the danger of the need for hiring different educators and technical developers outside of the core team and the risk of losing consistency in the educational material because of that. The timeframe is also mentioned as a possible challenge, which I noted earlier. 
Overall, I agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: Although this is a beautiful idea, it is in the wrong Challenge for it seeks to create a platform that provides video education for the youth rather than initiating an event. This proposal in its current state does not fit in any particular Challenge. Though 'DApps and Integration' or 'Scale-UP Cardano's Community Hub' does a bit fit, especially if the proposer were to also create an accompanying DApps. The proposer can also attempt to issue their own Challenge for Fund 9 with the topic; Providing Educational Tools that are constructed based on proficiency levels. If it were to be forced assessed based on the Challenge settings, this proposal would just barely solve the problem of onboarding and integrating new people. Since it involves education, it is highly recommended the proposer to reach out to the Catalyst School and explore avenues of collaboration.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no detailed experience provided. Of that is provided the experience is too vague and cannot be accounted for. No links are available also. This trend continues on to the team members. There is a notion that a certain individual with a particular skillset is needed, but who that individual is, is not stated. The budget asked does to an extent indicates the proposer has not been properly involved in the Project Catalyst process. Simply put, the proposer asks funding to create a platform from roughly zero. The funds will be used to create the platform; digitally and legally, to create the syllabus, to purchase hardware to create the syllabus, to purchase a lot in the VR space, to purchase the VR tool to access the VR space etc. This thought process is incorrect, for the Project Catalyst is not a fund to all-out purchase physical items for the proposers benefit. It is an empowerment tool, Project Catalyst to an extent is like a VC. And like a VC, when one does ask for funding they do not all-out ask to purchase various items without some form of validation for these purchases. Reckon this is purely due to having being still inexperienced in the Project Catalyst community. Again, highly reckon to reach out to Catalyst School and also to join the Project Catalyst Discord channel if they have not yet.
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap provided has an adjoining action plan but no specific milestones. There are also no measurable KPI's provided therefore auditing this proposal will be challenging, most specifically in term of deliverables effectiveness. Problem statement and solution is quite solid. If deliverables were to mention dApps and this proposal were to be in the 'DApps and Integration' Challenge, reckon the ratings would be more preferable. Please do submit again a proposal for Fund 8. Prior to that, please kindly go through the materials of Catalyst School, or even better participate in their workshops.

f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal is about the education platform. This team's (consist of proposer and his daughter) profile is described briefly enough for understanding with skill, experiences are suitable for implementation but it is hard to verify this through the link provided (http://cardanoclassroom.com/). Youtube links show that the proposer has done some similar activities with acceptable quality (my subjective evaluation).  The requested budget (>20% of the challenge)  is provided with structures, however, for a better view and understanding, the proposer should consider grouping cost items and providing explanations of the calculation base for each item. The defined challenge (balancing the organization of content with multiple creators while keeping the consistency of variety in course preparation to accommodate the needs of different student needs) is logical but without mitigation/risk management; my advice is a well-designed template and framework could be a solution to this kind of risk, the proposer should consider this.

Therefore, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's feasibility and I would give a score of 4
f6_assessments.q2:
The team's profile is described with limited information and it is hard to clarify through the link provided (http://cardanoclassroom.com/).  Information related to Roadmap, Timeline is presented enough to understand, however, the requested budget (which is >20% of the challenge's fund) contains many unclear points, making it difficult for the community to monitor. (ex: What is the basis for calculating cost items?). My advice is: for better auditability, as mentioned, the proposer should consider grouping cost items and providing explanations of the calculation base for each item. Besides, KPIs should be provided.
Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's auditability and give this proposal with a score of 3
